org.ambraproject.wombat.service.remote

Class AbstractRemoteService<S extends Closeable>

  • java.lang.Object

    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReaderService, StreamService

    abstract class AbstractRemoteService<S extends Closeable>
extends Object
implements RemoteService<S>
    Superclass for service beans that make calls to remote APIs.

    • Method Detail

      • getResponse

        public org.apache.http.client.methods.CloseableHttpResponse getResponse(URI targetUri,
                                                               org.apache.http.Header... headers)
                                                                 throws IOException
        Makes a request to the given URI, checks for response codes 400 or above, and returns the response.

        The caller must either close the returned CloseableHttpResponse object or close the InputStream to the response body (i.e., CloseableHttpResponse.getEntity().getContent()). This is very important, because leaving responses hanging open can starve the connection pool and cause horrible timeouts.

        Specified by:
        getResponse in interface RemoteService<S extends Closeable>
        Parameters:
        targetUri - the URI to which to send the request
        headers - headers to add to the request, if any
        Returns:
        response from the server
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error connecting to the server
        NullPointerException - if the address is null
        EntityNotFoundException - if the object at the address does not exist

      • request

        public S request(URI targetUri)
                            throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: RemoteService
        Make a request and open a stream as the response.

        The caller must close the stream when it is done reading. This is important for connection pooling.

        Specified by:
        request in interface RemoteService<S extends Closeable>
        Parameters:
        targetUri - the URI to which to send the request
        Returns:
        a stream to the response
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error connecting to the server
